allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add OpenAI Apps SDK support with inline video widgets

Converted the app to support OpenAI Apps SDK, enabling videos to display
inline inside ChatGPT using custom widgets instead of external links.

New Features:
- Apps SDK MCP server with widget support (apps-sdk/server.js)
- Custom video player widget component (src/widgets/video-player.html)
- Widget build system and automation (build-widgets.js)
- Widget asset compilation to assets/ directory
- Widget server on port 3001 for serving HTML/CSS/JS
- MCP responses include widget metadata for inline rendering

Build System:
- npm run build:widgets - Compile widget sources to assets
- npm run build:all - Build web components + widgets
- npm run start:apps-sdk - Start Apps SDK server with widgets

Documentation:
- APPS-SDK-GUIDE.md - Complete setup and deployment guide
- APPS-SDK-SUMMARY.md - Quick reference and architecture overview
- CUSTOM-GPT-SETUP.md - Custom GPT creation guide (HTTP API)
- openapi-schema.yaml - OpenAPI spec for Custom GPT actions
- render-apps-sdk.yaml - Render deployment config for Apps SDK
- Updated README.md with Apps SDK option

Project Structure:
- apps-sdk/ - Apps SDK MCP server
- src/widgets/ - Widget source files
- assets/ - Compiled widget bundles (auto-generated)

Three Deployment Options:
1. Local MCP Server - Simple local testing
2. HTTP API Server - Remote deployment with Custom GPT
3. Apps SDK - Inline widgets in ChatGPT (NEW!)

The Apps SDK version provides the best user experience with videos
displaying natively inside ChatGPT conversations using custom UI.

Ready for testing in ChatGPT Developer Mode.
EOF
)")
